repnme.cdata!:
Afghanistan - Public Financial Management
            Reform Project

abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Public Financial
            Management Reform Project (PFMR) for Afghanistan were as
            follows: outcomes were satisfactory, the risk to development
            outcome was high, the Bank performance was satisfactory, and
            the Borrower performance was also satisfactory. Some lessons
            learned included: management oversight is a key to good
            governance. This oversight is constrained by the lack of an
            effectively operating internal audit function, except in the
            Ministry of Finance (MOF). Building internal audit capacity
            in each line ministry cannot be done in the short term so
            implementing the approach provided in the public expenditure
            and finance law which entrusts MOF to establish internal
            audit throughout the government will be the most effective
            and expeditious route to establish the function across
            government, while at the same time supporting the
            development of internal audit in the line ministries, where
            feasible.  The country operating environment carries a high
            risk to perceived corruption. Further strengthening of
            procurement and audit including developing social
            accountability and support for the activities of the public
            accounts committee should help address these issues.  The
            PFMR tended, correctly, to measure results in terms of
            quantitative achievements (numbers trained, audits received,
            line ministries adopting rules) but these are more like
            necessary conditions for progress; the project could also
            have taken additional steps to track changes in the business
            culture (for example, timeliness and quality of functions;
            employee morale; turnover and absenteeism, among other
            indicators related to business culture).

repnme.cdata!:
Afghanistan - Public Financial Management
            Reform Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The Afghanistan public financial
            management reform project has two development objectives:
            (i) develop an efficient and effective public financial
            management system; and (ii) develop the human resource
            capacity of the Ministry of Finance and Control and Audit
            Office to ensure better operation of public financial management.
